noun.description: The action of forgiving or being forgiven for an error or offense.
examples: he obtained pardon for his sins

verb.description: Forgive or excuse (a person, error, or offense)
examples: I know Catherine will pardon me

exclamation.description: A request to a speaker to repeat something because one did not hear or understand it.
examples: “Pardon?” I said, cupping a hand to my ear

phrases: Now, the three of them are Pakistani or four of them are Pakistani, or of Pakistani descent, pardon me?
I beg your pardon for intruding
I am sorry, I beg your pardon - it is not referred to in the prospectus.
Oh, pardon me, I'm not too coordinated, I'm afraid.
We don't know precisely what happened - pardon me - OK, my apology.
origin: Middle English: from Old French pardun (noun), pardoner (verb), from medieval Latin perdonare concede, remit, from per- completely + donare give.
